headline: Magic Cookie Bars from EAGLE BRAND
description: These magic cookie bars are made with chocolate chips, nuts, shredded coconut, and condensed milk on a graham cracker crust for a delicious treat.

video.name: How to Make Magic Cookie Bars

name: Magic Cookie Bars from EAGLE BRAND
recipeIngredient: 1 (14 ounce) can EAGLE BRAND¬Æ Sweetened Condensed Milk

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). If using a glass dish, preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Coat a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
Mix graham cracker crumbs and butter in a bowl until well combined. Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish and press onto the bottom.
Pour sweetened condensed milk on graham cracker crust. Sprinkle with an even layer of chocolate chips, coconut, and nuts. Press toppings down firmly with the back of a fork.
Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, about 25 minutes. Cool completely, then cut into 36 bars or diamonds.

review.reviewBody: Followed the recipe exactly except substituted a cup of white chocolate chips. Used parchment paper in the pan for ease of cleaning and cutting. Came out great just with this recipe. No crumbling issues. My family loved it. I will be making again.

I have been making these Magic Bars for more than 30 years. They are great just as the recipe is. I have tried many different combinations of tops over the years. Try what you like in them, you can‚Äôt go wrong.

My grandmother made these as a treat when we spent weekends at her house and they were mine and my sisters favorite! I was thinking of this recently and decided to make them! I used two graham cracker pie shells and transferred to a baking dish drizzled a little extra butter over them and pressed down. I added two cans of the condensed milk and then layered dark, milk and white chocolate chips! I chose walnuts and slivered almonds to layer next with coconut topped off! It was a hit my family loved them said it was like homemade candy bars! These were very rich so small squares were better! I was thinking of trying a layer of peanut or almond butter on top of the graham crackers layer next time
Delicious.
I found them too sweet. Next time I will try unsweetened coconut. And maybe more nuts.

I love these rich, delicious bars, because you can make them ahead of time, and they are always a hit (unless someone doesn't like coconut). I like using different combinations of chips and nuts to add a little variety.
I love this recipe! I once made it a different way though. I used crushed Oreo cookies instead of graham crackers, and plain M&Ms instead of chocolate chips.

I got this recipe in the 60‚Äôs, however we make chocolate truffles so I left out the chocolate, switched out the walnuts for pecans. Layered graham cracker crust, bobs red mill shredded coconut, the best pecans that I can find and then pour the condensed milk over all. My young stepson calls it c√§ndy. There‚Äôs never too much.
made all the different ways for years and they are delicious üòã

My Aunt Shirley used to make these for all the birthday parties, baby showers when I was a kid. They were my favorite! I got to thinking of her the other day,she passed away a few years ago and decided to make these for my sister's for Thanksgiving. I'm sure only she and I will eat them because none of her kids or grandkids like nuts, so more for us!! They are cooking now and smell heavenly, just like I remember! Thank you!

I just took them out of the oven and they smell divine! I melted the butter right on the cookie sheet, added the cracker crumbs, then the chips, nuts and the coconut and covered the last layer with the sweetened condensed milk. I preset the oven at 365 degrees as I didn't remember the original temperature. It baked in 25 minutes. However, I did need to use an additional 1/2 cup of cookie crumbs. They're cooling right now. I implemented this recipe when it was first introduced. It made a lasting impression with my baking skills.

I hadn‚Äôt made these for years, but recently needed a treat to pass for a party so I made these cookie bars. I added English Toffee pieces as a layer in addition to the chocolate and butterscotch chips and made 1/2 pan with coconut and 1/2 with chopped pecans. I did pour the condensed milk over the top of the layers versus below and they turned out very well. I lined my pan with Reynolds¬Æ Release Aluminum foil and the bars came right out of the pan. I did chill after cutting, but it‚Äôs not necessary.
My mom used to make this for us all the time. Happy childhood memories!

Magic bars have always been a fan favorite at any get together. Funny thing is, for over 30 years, I never knew we were making it wrong. We did layers: crumbs, coconut, nuts, and chocolate chips THEN poured the sweeten milk over the top of everything! Lol Doesn't matter to me, still love these tasty bars.
Fun fact: I‚Äôve been enjoying these bars, since I was wee. We used to called the Grandma Netty Cookies. Thank you, so much for the recipe. I can finally duplicate, a childhood food memory.
Everyone loved it. Received a request to make for the bake sale.
I added butterscotch chips along with the chocolate chips. I also blended semi sweet chocolate with milk chocolate chips & chopped walnuts! Yum yum!

We love magic cookie bars! This is my "go to" recipe. Tonight I changed it up a bit. I divided the 9x13 pan in half. On one end, on top of the graham crust, I added a layer of Hazelnut Chocolate spread before adding the chocolate chips, coconut and condensed milk. One the other end I made a cheesecake layer, consisting of a softened 8oz. cream cheese, one egg, 1/3 of a cup of sugar and a tsp of vanilla. Then I added, the coconut, chocolate chips and condensed milk. We loved both flavors. I am always adding new stuff. Give it a try and create your own flavors.

I love this recipe but I guess I did something wrong. I followed the directions and let them cool but they came out gooey. If I had let them cook any longer, the crust and edges would have burned. I used a premade graham crust also. I don't know what went wrong. I took a picture of it. I don't think it looks too good. lol. any thoughts? ty.
Always a favorite with our family!
Very tasty and very rich!!
Love this recipe. Family favorite. I always double the graham crackers as it‚Äôs just too thin.

Made these after several years. I had all ingredients except graham crackers . I had some of those Danish butter cookies and they worked deliciously. Much tastier than the crackers! I will always make them with the cookies.

They are very gooey
1.don't think you need the whole can of condensed milk 
2. Or 2 cups of graham cracker crust. 
3. Maybe smaller pan.
I'll stick to my way and not do a whole can
Awesome! Easy

The Magic Bar has been a favourite however this recipe is not the original.i knew something was off. This one has less graham crackers, less butter and way too much chocolate chips for proportion of the bar. Without the proper ‚Äòbase and graham crackers bottom‚Äô it crumbled (even after the butter trick mentioned here many times in the comments.) All I taste is chocolate‚Ä¶and I even cut back due to the comments posted.

I make magic cookie bars every year but I do it differently & add different ingredients. I have 2 pans in the oven right now. I use a large mixing bowl to which I add 2 cans of sweetened condensed milk & I mix into that 1 TBLS of almond extract. Then I add 1 large bac of coconut flakes & 11oz bag of milk chocolate chips. & 11 ounce bag of white chocolate chips & today I also added a cup of ground up butterfinger bits & 1 cup of sea salt caramel chips & 1 11oz bag of mini M&Ms. I stir all that together then I take 2 10x13 cookie sheets to which I add 1 stick of butter to each pan. Melt that in the oven then sprinkle pre finally crushed 3 sleeves graham cracker crumbs. Then I spoon on the mixture I made with the coconut & mixture of chips. Then bake in a 350* oven for about 20 minutes until the tops are golden brown. Let cool then enjoy! Last year I added chopped up cream De Menthe baking chips. It's fun to mix up different additions each year & everyone loves them! The sky is the limit to how it can be changed each year.
Always a Christmas favorite!!
I remember my mother making these so many years ago. I wanted to give them a try myself and glad I did. Looks good but my gosh they smell wonderful as well. :)

I think there is an error with this recipe. I have used the Eagle Brand cookbook for years and it calls for only 1 c of chocolate chips. The substitutions section appears to back this up. I noticed other reviewers stating that 2 c is too many as well.

This is a great easy dessert. I loved it as a child many years ago and just as much today. I like the condensed milk on top of everything but it‚Äôs really personal preference. If you want to line the pan I would use parchment paper rather than foil to avoid pieces of foil in my dessert.

Don't get me wrong, they taste really good, albeit really sweet. I followed the recipe but they never firmed up. Had to use a spoon to serve them.
I will try a different recipe next time.
Scrumptious! Reminds me of my childhood & my grandmother! Will make again!
Pretty good
Ive made these for years but have never added nuts! Im going to try it today with nuts. The only thing different that I do, is that I put the condensed milk on the top. Try it!
They came delicious. Baked under 25 mins. Just keep an eye on it.
I put down the layer of buttered graham cracker crumbs and thought, Oh no, that'll never do! and doubled the recipe. Sinful but incredibly marvelous!!
Delicious, my mom made them for me and now I make them! Super easy!
Great recipe. A winner every Christmas.

I pour the sweetened condensed milk last, over all of it---the bars are so much better! Plus, I don't use all the chocolate chips, I just eyeball them, making sure they're evenly distributed over the coconut. These are delicious!
Simple to make. Only a few ingredients that are easy to find. Really delicious!
Been making these since I was a kid so delicious

Really good recipe. Quick and easy. I added a little kosher salt to balance the sweetness. Maybe next time I will use salted pecans. My family hates coconut and pecans in food but this combination is amazing! Must have!!!

This was great- to take it over the top, try crushing some peanut butter pretzels into the graham cracker crust. No need to substitute, just add. I didn‚Äôt think there was enough graham cracker for the bottom anyways

I first made these bars over 45 years ago. I decided to make them again for the first time in forever. I am terribly disappointed at the outcome. The condensed milk needs to go on last; after the crust, chips, nuts, and coconut. Otherwise, you do not get that lovely caramel on top and the bars just fall apart rather than slicing into nice even squares. I doubt I will make these again in my lifetime; if I wait another 40 years, I will be well over 100 years old.
Super easy delicious treat!

I love magic bars, they are my most favorite treat ever! I always crush 2 packages of the graham crackers but the one stick of butter works just fine. The Bakers name brand coconut is worth the extra 50¬¢ over store brand coconut, it's juicy and flavorful and never dry. I put in the whole bag of coconut, a whole bag of milk chocolate chips, a bag of dark chocolate chips, a bag of Heath bar chopped toffee bits, a can of sweetened condensed milk over the graham cracker crust and then another can sweetened condensed milk over the coconut/chocolate chip mixture. I sprinkled some kosher salt over the top because at the moment I don't have any pretzels or nuts. You can honestly add anything to the coconut mixture and it would be delicious!

The first batch came out crumbly but ok. The second batch I put all the coconut, chocolate chips and walnuts in a bowl. I poured the condensed milk over them and stirred until every single piece was coated. Then I pressed them in the pan and the came out absolutely perfect. No more crumbling from pieces that didn't get coated.
added 1/4 tsp cinnamon to bottom layer, chocolate sweetened condensed milk which I heated beforehand so it would pour easier.
Making minis

I want to give this higher stars but idk what I did wrong! They came out really soft in the middle, and even after baking them for a bit longer when we cut into them when semi-cool the condensed milk had flooded the bottom and the Graham cracker crust was completely soft/soggy. Still taste great, but not a bar you can really bite into? I used a slightly smaller pan, does that make a difference?

I've made this so many time.
Great for the holidays and making with family and friends.
 Now I would like to know if anyone used unsweetened coconut flakes instead of sweetened coconut flakes.
Awesome, Just like I REMEMBERED MOM MAKING.
swapped nuts for Reeses Pieces minis! Delicious!!
These are always a hit at the house everyone loves them great recipe thank you

I added heath bar morsels. Very nice flavor.
I like the traditional recipe best of all.
They licked the pan clean. I made it for Super Bowl and will be making often.
Delicious!! I made the recipe as is and I have had to make it 3x in 2 days because it keeps on disappearing :) 2nd time I made it I added an extra cup of c.chips, yum!
It sticks together much better if you pour the sweetened condensed milk over all. My version is walnuts and milk chocolate chips. I‚Äôve never had to throw away any or ‚Äúbring home‚Äù any.
We love these!!
I do not own a food processor, the use of a rolling pin and crackers in the bag was horrible.
So delicious!! We loved them with 1/2 butterscotch chips and 1/2 chocolate chips. We renamed them cookie crack because they‚Äôre so addictive!
I added butterscotch chips and pecans . They were a hit!
I have made these several times and they are so good. One tip I might add is to put the coconut on first and then the chocolate chips and nuts. It keeps the coconut from falling off when you eat it.
These are super easy and always a tremendous crowd pleaser !!

Ok I must be glutton for punishment, BUT instead of Graham crackers , I use Oreos (not the cream middle just cookie outside), and when I tell you it took the bars to another level I'm not kidding! These things are already rich but the chocolatey crust is just divine! I used a whole container of Oreos with the same amount of butter and it seems to work well enough. I dare you to try it!

I made as directed, but used gluten free graham crackers. Recipe turned out well, but I made another batch at the same time using the (Gluten Free) Magic Cookie Bars recipe. This other one used a homemade peanut butter crust that really improved this basic idea.

First of all - being a foodie this dessert is awesome but this recipe is flawed. First you mix the melted butter and g cracker crumbs and press those down w a fork. Do NOT pour on the sw cond milk - it goes last and is the glue that holds it all together. Sprinkle choc chips, pecans, then coconut then pour ribbons of sw cond milk over it and bake. Looks like this recipe was hurriedly submitted by someone who had never baked this and only halfway read the recipe.

A co-worker gave me the recipe for these cookie bars many years ago. The recipe was mostly the same but the sweetened condensed milk was poured over the top (after the coconut). I simply cannot bring myself to make it with the milk poured over the graham cracker/butter crust. Same ingredients, but I think doing it the old way is best. Maybe one day I'll try it.
This is an old time fav of mine and I love to eat one with a glass of milk.

Add combination of 1C butterscotch with 1C semisweet morsels; reduce nuts to 1/2C.
After adding the morsels, nuts and coconut, layer 2C mini marshmallows and pour 1 can sweetened condensed milk over the top of marshmallows, then bake.
We‚Äôve been making these in our family for years!!! Love them. Now I need to find a version that is tree but free fro my daughter. I of curse will still make these for my brothers and I. So YUMMY!
Perfect!! Made exactly as written! Thank you!
My go to Christmas office, party, snack, gift giving recipe. Everybody loves them!!
Have made these for decades and always poured the milk on as last layer. Glues everything together and keeps nuts or coconut from burning.
The only change was pouring the condensed milk on top of the chips nuts and coconut.
butterscotch and chocolate pieces

Make the bars like the recipe suggest but tweek it slightly by adding more coconuts (2/3cups) just because of adding white chocolate morsels, I mix my morsels, nuts, and coconuts in a Bowl so all the ingredients are evenly distributed. Also I pour 1/2 the condensed milk on the crust, then the remainder over the topping mixture. Yum yum for the tum tum my boyfriend gets these only in December for the Christmas Holidays, he waits all year for these goodie.

These are great, but I tried making them with a substitution suggested by my sister, Sheryl, and they were absolute perfection! My husband called them "Burnt Squares" because of their appearance, but nobody could dispute the amazing taste! Just replace the Graham crumbs with an equal amount of Oreo crumbs mixed with 1/4 cup of white sugar. Delicious!

I made this in 9x13 pan. Increased the ingredient for the crust only by half.
2 - 1/4 cups graham crackers
3/4 cup melted butter
My mom made theses. One of my favorite bar cookies from my childhood!

I made this in 9x13 pan. Increased the ingredient for the crust only by half.
2 - 1/4 cups graham crackers
3/4 cup melted butter
My mom made theses. One of my favorite bar cookies from my childhood!

I made these and doubled the recipe. I added 1.5 cups of quick cook oats and a cup of flour to the butter/graham cracker mixture. I also added 1.5 tsp of kosher salt. I increased the butter to 1 cup total (for doubled recipe. I baked these off for 8 minutes and allowed to cool before adding the milk. I used heath bar crunch bits in addition to the chocolate chips. Smothered with the nuts, coconut then added more chocolate chips and had a small handful of salted caramel chips I sprinkled on top. Baked an additional 10 minutes to make sure all was melted and browned. Came out quite amazing!!
Always delicious.
My mom received a recipe called Hello Dolly Bars in 1969 from her sister. It was delicious, the recipe included vanilla wafer crumbs instead of graham cracker crumbs.
My family loves these!
I used different flavors instead of just chocolate I used butterscotch and white chocolate as well as toffee pieces my kids loved them
Added vanilla, andcyes, made them before, 20 years ago, so first time in decades lol. Good squares, hits all the sweet chocolate, nuts coconut cravings..

Used to make these when I was little and loved them. Since being diagnosed with celiac, I made the the graham cracker crust with Schar gluten free honey Graham‚Äôs. Not as crisp, but just as delicious. I would NOT add 2 cups of chocolate chips. I am all about chocolate, but this was overwhelming. Try halving it with one cup. This is a great dessert to make with little kids - so easy and fun! My 2 yr old and 5 year old loved putting all the layers on

This was super easy to make! I loved how fast it all came together. I somewhat regret the caramel as it‚Äôs really chewy now, but other than that I‚Äôm really happy with it! Would definitely make it again.
Used chocolate graham crackers
I have been making this for a long time now with many experiments. My current fav is fresh blueberries, dark chocolate chips small ground walnuts (layered), raisins and coconut...
I made this but I if i ever make it again I would cut the amount of chocolate chips in half.

I used to order these at the coffee shop at school (quite some time ago). I never realized how easy they are to make. I followed the recipe as written, and they were a big hit at a work party. Will make again!
used 1 cup butterscotch, 1 cup chocolate instead of 2 chocolate, and it was good. going to try maybe peanut butter chips and see what happens if the condensed milk is more near the top as well.
I trick I learned was to always put the condensed milk on last. Pour it over the coconut. It makes it a bit more gooey and it holds everything together, otherwise your coconut falls off.

WATCH WHILE YOU‚ÄôRE BAKING!!!! I followed this recipe to the T and checked them 3 mins before my timer goes off and my cookies are burnt! :( I guess our oven is too hot so def watch it while you‚Äôre baking. I gave 5 star because it‚Äôs simple to make. I will def make it again and just watch them closely while they bake. It smells delicious even though their burnt.
My husband and son do not like coconut...so I replaced the coconut with oatmeal. BIG HIT!
Scrumptious!

item.name: Magic Cookie Bars from EAGLE BRAND
